frame.name: Evidence
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Support</fen>, a phenomenon or fact, lends support to a claim or proposed course of action, the <fen>Proposition</fen>, where the <fen>Domain_of_relevance</fen> may also be expressed. Some of the words in this frame (e.g. argue) are communication words used in a non-communicative, epistemic sense.
<ex><fex name="Support">The latest poll results</fex> <t>show</t> <fex name="Proposition">that support of the president is at an all-time low.</fex></ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Support
FE.definition: <def-root>Support is a fact that lends epistemic support to a claim, or that provides a reason for a course of action. Typically it is expressed as an External Argument. <ex><fex name="Support">The fact that you lied to me</fex> <t>shows</t> that I shouldn't trust you.</ex> <ex><fex name="Support">The look on your face</fex> <t>reveals</t> that you are lying.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Proposition
FE.definition: <def-root>This is a belief, claim, or proposed course of action to which the Support lends validity. Normally it is expressed as a Finite Clause Complement: <ex>The fact that you lied to me <t>shows</t> <fex name="Proposition">that I shouldn't trust you</fex>.</ex> Some words in this frame require the proposition to be expressed as an NP Object: <ex>The fact that you lied <t>substantiates</t> <fex name="Proposition">the claim that you can't be trusted</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the degree to which a <fen>Proposition</fen> is supported. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the manner in which a <fen>Proposition</fen> is supported. <ex>The results of the experiments <t>proved</t> the hypothesis <fex name="Manner">brilliantly</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An intermediate logical step that justifies the relationship of the <fen>Support</fen> to the <fen>Proposition</fen>. <ex>Tiny patterns in fossil rocks can <t>demonstrate</t> that dinosaurs and pterosaurs were (at least potentially) warm blooded <fex name="Mns">by showing that they had feathers or hair, today found only among endotherms</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>A description of the status of the <fen>Support</fen> within its relationship to the <fen>Proposition</fen>. This <t>proves</t> my conclusions <fex name="Depictive">all by itself</fex>.</def-root>

FE.name: Domain_of_relevance
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the domain (usually, time or space) for which a given <fen>Proposition</fen> is true. </def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person for whom the <fen>Proposition</fen> is supported by the <fen>Support</fen>.
<ex>The behavior of the children <t>indicated</t> <fex name="Cognizer">to the teacher</fex> that further action was required on his part.</ex></def-root>
